com.informix.lang

Class JavaToIfxType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.informix.lang.JavaToIfxType

  • public final class JavaToIfxType
extends java.lang.Object
    This static class handles all the Java to Informix data conversion. A separate method is provided for each conversion. All the conversion fns return a byte array for writing to output stream to an extrnal server. For variable length types (DECIMAL, TIMESTAMP, VARCHAR) the first two bytes are the length of the "data bytes" Note: If a padding byte is needed to make the sequence even in length that must be done by the fns that actually write the bytes to the stream.

      protected static boolean TruncateFractSec
      if false then rounds up fractional seconds, possibly upto year In order to do rounding, set this to false and uncomment the series of ifs inside convertTimestampToDecimal() below.

      • TruncateFractSec

        protected static final boolean TruncateFractSec
        if false then rounds up fractional seconds, possibly upto year In order to do rounding, set this to false and uncomment the series of ifs inside convertTimestampToDecimal() below. Of course, the code has to be recompiled too.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JavaToIfxChar

        public byte[] JavaToIfxChar(java.lang.String s,
                   boolean usestrenc)
                     throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                            java.sql.SQLException
        Converts a Java String to an Informix Char (n) (in a byte array) The first 2 bytes encode the length of the string. Remaining bytes encode the characters in the string
        Parameters:
        s - String to be converted TBD ??? Shouldnt we use 2 bytes per char due to Unicode?
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • convertNanosToFract

        public static java.lang.String convertNanosToFract(int nano)
        Converts first to a number that retains high 5 digits and reduces to a string. Truncates or rounds based on static flag TruncateFractSec.
        Parameters:
        nano - number representing nano seconds

      • convertTimestampToDecimal

        public static Decimal convertTimestampToDecimal(java.sql.Timestamp t)
        Creates a Decimal from the Timestamp that represents its value as a decimal number of the form: yyyymmddhhmmss.fffff Note: For now truncates fractional digits 6-9 instead of rounding Since rounding could in worst case propagate all the way to year we will hold off on doing it until need is clearly expressed. However, code is already there to do rounding. It only needs to be made activ e.
